messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a house with 21 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 21, 5, 24, 9, 4, and 13. Room 2 is connected to rooms 22, 6, 10, 11, 7, and 14. Room 3 is connected to rooms 35, 41, 23, 12, 8, and 20. Room 4 is connected to rooms 13, 21, 5, 24, and 9. Room 5 is connected to rooms 24, 9, 13, and 21. Room 6 is connected to rooms 24, 10, 11, 7, and 14. Room 7 is connected to rooms 14, 22, 10, and 11. Room 8 is connected to rooms 20, 35, 41, 23, and 12. Room 9 is connected to rooms 13, 21, and 41. Room 10 is connected to rooms 11, 14, and 22. Room 11 is connected to rooms 14 and 22. Room 12 is connected to rooms 20, 35, 41, and 23. Room 13 is connected to rooms 21, and 24. Room 14 is connected to rooms 22. Room 20 is connected to rooms 35, 41, and 23. Room 21 is connected to room 24. Room 22 is connected to room 23. Room 23 is connected to rooms 35. Room 35 is connected to room 41. You have been told that there is a reward of 10 for visiting room 22. You are in room 24 and a portal appears with which you can teleport to any room only once. At the same time, you have been told that there is no connection between room 24 and 6. From room 24, what is the path that yields the most reward? Please list the room numbers in order, separated by commas.

If it's an array, it would be much easier.
If it's in a single line, break each number after comma, and check the remaining parts that can be combined with previous ones.
Examine each room to see if those numbers are in its connections. Check some pseudo code:

@cucumber, you're not wrong that it might be easier to do this in batch but sometimes, you can't take that approach for some reason. In this case, I needed to get the data as it came up in rows, not as an array, and I didn't want to pick up many fields beyond the needed ones. That's part of why I'm working in this specific way.

Thanks smilebot for just giving me code that I can count on!
I am trying to do something that I haven't done before, so bear with me.

I also wanted to ask you if someone figures out a way that this part can be simplified given the fact that some of my data is in character format "'room 3' "

but some in array format as well. I wonder if there is a way for me to not have to specify the array dimension each time. I can give the array dimension but
